title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe any of the following urban models.
The response correctly describes ONE of the following urban models.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions:
The response does not correctly describe where squatter settlements are located in the Latin American urban model compared with the Southeast Asia urban model.

路 In both the Latin American and Southeast Asian urban models, squatter settlements are located on the edge/periphery of the city. In the Southeast Asian urban model, squatter settlements are interspersed with new suburbs.

The response provides the following description of where squatter settlements are located in the Latin American urban model compared with the Southeast Asia urban model:

路 In both the Latin American and Southeast Asian urban models, squatter settlements are located on the edge/periphery of the city. In the Southeast Asian urban model, squatter settlements are interspersed with new suburbs.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions:
The response does not correctly describe the following difference in the process used by settlers to gain land tenure in squatter settlements compared with formal settlements.

路 In formal settlements, people gain land tenure by renting or purchasing property. In squatter settlements, by contrast, settlers may gain land tenure through any one of the following means.

The response correctly describes the following difference in the process used by settlers to gain land tenure in squatter settlements compared with formal settlements.

路 In formal settlements, people gain land tenure by renting or purchasing property. In squatter settlements, by contrast, settlers may gain land tenure through any one of the following means.
